definitions.definition: The result of copying; an identical or nearly identical duplicate of an original .
examples: Please bring me at least 200 copies of this report. The photocopier is down the hall on the right.

His new book is out. I have a signed copy . He'll send you a copy if you want one. He's giving free copies to his former colleagues who want one. The press run is 3000 copies , and he hopes to sell more press runs after this one.
I already saw their draft. She emailed me a copy yesterday. I can forward it to you so that you have your own copy .

subdefinitions.definition: The result of gene or chromosomal duplication.
examples: Every cell in this organism contains a copy of each gene, but whether that copy will be expressed depends on complex factors of cell differentiation and epigenetics.

definitions.definition: An imitation , sometimes of inferior quality.
examples: That handbag is a copy . You can tell because the buckle is different.

definitions.definition: The text (words, content ) that is to be typeset or similarly prepared and published .
examples: This organization doesn't publish any copy that hasn't been edited by a good copy editor.

subdefinitions.definition: The output of copywriters , who are employed to write material which encourages consumers to buy goods or services.
The text to be set into newspaper articles, magazine pages, or similar.
examples: Submit all copy to the appropriate editor.

definitions.definition: A person employed to carry copy and run errands.

examples: Tim got in trouble for forgetting his maths copy .

definitions.definition: A particular instance of a book : a single printed impression or digital file representing it.
examples: Our town's public library has several copies of the Bible, in each of several editions.
Our town's public library has several copies of the second edition of Smith's textbook, but it doesn't yet have any copies of any newer edition.

definitions.definition: A particular instance of an issue of a periodical (e.g., magazine , journal , bulletin ): a single printed impression or digital file representing that issue; ( metonynmically ) the issue .
examples: Have you seen the latest copy of Newsweek yet?

definitions.definition: Writing paper of a particular size: Synonym of bastard .
That which is to be imitated, transcribed, or reproduced; a pattern, model , or example.
examples: His virtues are an excellent copy for imitation.

definitions.definition: An abundance or plenty of anything.

main_definition: The result of copying; an identical or nearly identical duplicate of an original .
secondary_definitions: An imitation , sometimes of inferior quality.
( typography , journalism , publishing ) The text (words, content ) that is to be typeset or similarly prepared and published .
( journalism ) A person employed to carry copy and run errands.
A particular instance of a book : a single printed impression or digital file representing it.
A particular instance of an issue of a periodical (e.g., magazine , journal , bulletin ): a single printed impression or digital file representing that issue; ( metonynmically ) the issue .
( archaic ) Writing paper of a particular size: Synonym of bastard .
( obsolete ) That which is to be imitated, transcribed, or reproduced; a pattern, model , or example.
( obsolete ) An abundance or plenty of anything.
